document.title: 2021 Minnesota K12 Academic Standards in Social Studies Final

01B655B1A53F40758353ECD103CF24F1.description:
Examine contemporary challenges and successes regarding
Tribal Nations and the United States government (local, state,
federal).

23221154E5EB4C44BB13CF3D569DB5B1.description:
Tribal Nations: Evaluate the
unique political status, trust
relationships and governing
structures of sovereign Tribal
Nations and the United States.

DA536FBC98214DCF9A4AC474799524DD.description:
Compare and contrast governing structures of Tribal Nations
within Minnesota and the United States.

366D0786896A4293B00C37147580FFDE.description:
Tribal Nations: Evaluate the
unique political status, trust
relationships and governing
structures of sovereign Tribal
Nations and the United States.

718583D4C2804BB68BA908324DC22A8C.description:
Compare and contrast trust relationships between Tribal
Nations and Minnesota’s state and local governments, United
States government and governments of other nations.

7F31B80ACC1A4F888C04B35451586048.description:
Tribal Nations: Evaluate the
unique political status, trust
relationships and governing
structures of sovereign Tribal
Nations and the United States.

A0233E66EAC045B2AA614B47D67CF717.description:
Evaluate the unique political status of Tribal Nations in relation
to the United States.

874DC67AED534F57BD5FF258D2D90011.description:
Tribal Nations: Evaluate the
unique political status, trust
relationships and governing
structures of sovereign Tribal
Nations and the United States.

F197B52321164B80A67088F287872035.description:
Examine a public policy issue by defining the problem,
developing alternative courses of action, evaluating the
consequences of each alternative, selecting a course of action,
and designing a plan to implement the action and resolve the
problem.

3DE271A875D047738F4007C883F24E49.description:
Public Policy: Analyze how
public policy is shaped by
governmental and nongovernmental institutions.
Analyze how people and
communities take action to solve
problems and shape public policy.

CEFF630DB6AE4E2B8978FAAD8C1B662B.description:
Analyze the role of interest groups, various types of media and
public opinion on the political process and public policy
formation.

4BB2701CE3674EE794273A192DD93E94.description:
Public Policy: Analyze how
public policy is shaped by
governmental and nongovernmental institutions.
Analyze how people and
communities take action to solve
problems and shape public policy.

AE0CA5E26C6341898E0F1F34DF2BDDBB.description:
Analyze the impact of political parties on elections and public
policy formation.

44E0562BE3D1499DAB620A3AB39395C4.description:
Public Policy: Analyze how
public policy is shaped by
governmental and nongovernmental institutions.
Analyze how people and
communities take action to solve
problems and shape public policy.

340CBFDD291042CCA433C5880CF839BC.description:
Explain the role of international law in world affairs. Evaluate
the impact of the participation of nation states in international
organizations.

7AF8D956A12347A2AC12B532329092EB.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

DC56C684FF954941968022EEFA599BFE.description:
Explain how individuals, corporations, cooperatives, labor, civic
groups and/or other groups influence United States foreign
policy.

F11E1C53450542FDB3C4256281C11252.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

2D818408CCA342849B4DF24677C63865.description:
Compare and contrast the budgets of the United States and
Minnesota governments, describing the major sources of
revenue and categories of spending for each.

2EFB498E9CEF443D9D87272DABAD5054.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

0E7DC734783D4DC2988DD3A6483DEC6F.description:
Explain the powers and operations of local government in
Minnesota.

096A730DB5C54266AD908F32363A7CBC.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

62639FC4217340BF92FD04F797BAF534.description:
Explain the powers and operations of the State of Minnesota
government as defined in its constitution and its relationship
with the federal government and Tribal governments.

0ABA94AECC6F4134B334B53994037849.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

C273364AAFB04117B4419708C15CC113.description:
Describe the purposes, types and sources of laws and rules.
Evaluate their impact.

2ADCD5CB8BC84E60BD010217F3D82531.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

FC53D29759B64762BE53F46D25F11FEC.description:
Analyze how the United States political system is shaped by
elections and the election process and procedures involved in
voting.

3AFCF7EA9CCF496590EDA2C8D151E6D2.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

0BD28B19460B4402A5E2B12F203162EA.description:
Analyze the purposes, organization, functions and processes of
the judicial branch as enumerated in Article 3 of the U.S.
Constitution.

527D1F0603A44D75949782A78979C6B2.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

AEE992DDC71542628995AA145AA15514.description:
Analyze the purposes, organization, functions and processes of
the executive branch as enumerated in Article 2 of the U.S.
Constitution.

31F32EFDD72C4B6597F1FBD7DB5B6F1C.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

6299979CD1B842E789B9FB402FBC2300.description:
Analyze the purposes, organization, functions and processes of
the legislative branch as enumerated in Article 1 of the U.S.
Constitution.

B32AC1394C7A44F1A8A8B2CAA1BF98C3.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

C7B458EC570945ACA1ED553F093E9431.description:
Evaluate federalism and the provisions of the U.S. Constitution,
which delegate to the federal government the powers
necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was established.
Distinguish between those powers and the powers retained by
the people and the states.

7983A66F3E7E443CA258676466EDD890.description:
Governmental Institutions and
Political Processes: Explain and
evaluate processes, rules and
laws of United States
governmental institutions at
local, state and federal levels and
within Tribal Nations.

0F831938D0A548EBB847E7A0C4B596EE.description:
Explain how citizenship processes, requirements and duties are
established by law. Evaluate the struggle for citizenship since
the founding period.

62A3BEF3683E42A1AC1D87400361FBA4.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

4390E6B188684B2897BC0CED2CCE42D9.description:
Explain the responsibilities and duties for all individuals in a
republic.

E2C9DF9E65444EF18AFCE2D36C2831C9.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

A24084877AD84064A83975D2BC2346F0.description:
Evaluate the current and historical interpretations of the
principles of due process and equal protection of the law in the
14th Amendment. Analyze evolving civil rights in legislative
action and court interpretation.

C5F3BD3937A64BEFA6CA87E61F86907C.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

CB4B34812F7442C591C2C2535047C90D.description:
Explain the scope and limits of rights of the accused during trial
and punishment under the Sixth and Eighth Amendments.
Explain changes created by legislative action and court
interpretation.

5E716077DE83440DA5911D35393F43B4.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

FB2D9DAB730D49D9897BE8DF79C286EF.description:
Explain the scope and limits of rights of the accused pretrial
under the Fourth and Fifth Amendments. Explain changes
created by legislative action and court interpretation.

B2EC0B9E730D4991BD8DF633BBDACF0D.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

4138EF8F993B4FA6A2D34822D2F2C7A8.description:
Explain the scope and limits of rights protected by the First and
Second Amendments. Explain changes created by legislative
action and court interpretation.

D8A59CFE89CA4838AEB6BC1FF596AC25.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

4CA9B0D1B6314508845CC558A962A260.description:
Compare rights in the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights
and subsequent amendments, the rights in the Constitution of
the State of Minnesota, and the Universal Declaration of Human
Rights.

A8E1EEDE9BA14F92B78A25BFED3CC361.description:
Rights and Responsibilities:
Explain and evaluate rights,
duties and responsibilities in
democratic society.

509EFF3F043E43E4A1787652083B5D54.description:
Analyze current tensions between the government’s dual role
of protecting individual rights and promoting the general
welfare, the struggle between majority rule and minority rights,
and the tension between liberty and equality at all levels.

2DE4F221B123463C9586E7A96599A8B7.description:
Democratic Values and
Principles: Explain democratic
values and principles that guide
governments, societies and
communities. Analyze the
tensions within the United States
constitutional government.

E51CBE4E70DC4C969EB52415D9B89DD6.description:
Explain the significance of democratic values and principles to
well-functioning democratic processes and elections.

F266257CE02941ABB2F7839B3C632888.description:
Democratic Values and
Principles: Explain democratic
values and principles that guide
governments, societies and
communities. Analyze the
tensions within the United States
constitutional government.

F9EEB43721B341D6A0C3899E77F3F22F.description:
Analyze the foundational ideas of the United States government
embedded in founding era documents: natural rights
philosophy, social contract, civic virtue, popular sovereignty,
constitutionalism, representative democracy, political factions,
federalism and individual rights.

14A91FC0E15441F9965AEF053C88E01B.description:
Democratic Values and
Principles: Explain democratic
values and principles that guide
governments, societies and
communities. Analyze the
tensions within the United States
constitutional government.

BC0CAB0C0E3F4416ACD4B1127DD404BD.description:
Analyze how means of civic engagement are used to influence
the American political system at all levels.

17C646D6116B497CB52D4904ECDA5418.description:
Civic Skills: Apply civic
reasoning and demonstrate civic
skills for the purpose of informed
and engaged lifelong civic
participation.

9B1CC350FE4146E39F14C0B9D269D05E.description:
Curate and evaluate various sources of information and forms
of political persuasion, including digital, for validity, accuracy,
ideology, emotional appeals, bias and prejudice.

A3188FF21D4D4B50BBCB49154E4BC762.description:
Civic Skills: Apply civic
reasoning and demonstrate civic
skills for the purpose of informed
and engaged lifelong civic
participation.

7781A411FB5E46A191F64F7862D89124.description:
Demonstrate the skills necessary to participate in the election
process and evaluate how access to voting is impacted by law
and application of law.

D35518D0E95A4627BD667C0460ACC64E.description:
Civic Skills: Apply civic
reasoning and demonstrate civic
skills for the purpose of informed
and engaged lifelong civic
participation.

84DDD60030A34ADDA433976ABBD23DDF.description:
Demonstrate civic skills that enable people to be informed on
current issues in order to monitor and influence state, local
tribal, national or international affairs.

671DD59DC6FC41E7A891F76C07954F1E.description:
Civic Skills: Apply civic
reasoning and demonstrate civic
skills for the purpose of informed
and engaged lifelong civic
participation.
